alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Dutchess; Greene; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 8:00PM EDT until September 07 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Ulster County in east central New York... Dutchess County in east central New York... Southwestern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Greene County in east central New York... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 800 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hunter to Rhinebeck to near Fishkill, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, Beacon, Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Pawling, Hyde Park, Milton, Pleasant Valley, Claverack, Wappingers Falls, Amenia, Livingston, Copake, Highland, Pine Plains, Fishkill and Clermont. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Ulster County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
